paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

paragraphs.content: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.

paragraphs.content: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

paragraphs.content: Many, O LORD my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

paragraphs.content: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.

paragraphs.content: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

paragraphs.content: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.

paragraphs.content: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord, thou knowest.

paragraphs.content: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.

paragraphs.content: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

paragraphs.content: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.

paragraphs.content: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me: O LORD, make haste to help me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.

paragraphs.content: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

paragraphs.content: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.

paragraphs.content: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord be magnified.

paragraphs.content: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
